blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling drain package behavior and output.

variables.name: AUXILIARY
variables.description: Defines auxiliary variable names to be associated with each drain entry.
variables.tooltip: One or more names of auxiliary variables read with each drain entry. Can be used for transport concentrations or user-defined data.

variables.name: AUXMULTNAME
variables.description: Name of the auxiliary variable to be used as a multiplier for the drain conductance.
variables.tooltip: The named auxiliary variable is multiplied by COND to compute the actual drain conductance.

variables.name: BOUNDNAMES
variables.description: Keyword to activate reading of boundary names for each drain.
variables.tooltip: When specified, each drain entry can include an optional text name for grouping in budget reporting and observations.

variables.name: PRINT_INPUT
variables.description: Keyword to print drain input data to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, drain data read for each stress period is echoed to the listing file.

variables.name: PRINT_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to print drain flow rates to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, computed drain flow rates are printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save drain flow terms to the cell-by-cell budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, drain flow terms are written to the binary budget file for post-processing.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data specifying drain locations, elevations, and conductances.

variables.name: CELLID
variables.description: Cell identifier for the drain location (layer, row, column for DIS; layer, cell2d for DISV; node for DISU).
variables.tooltip: Identifies the model cell containing the drain. The drain only removes water from the model; it cannot add water.

variables.name: ELEV
variables.description: Drain elevation, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The elevation of the drain. When the head in the cell is above this elevation, water flows out of the cell at a rate proportional to the head difference. When head is below the drain elevation, no flow occurs.

variables.name: COND
variables.description: Hydraulic conductance of the drain, in units of length squared per time.
variables.tooltip: Controls the rate of drainage. Flow out of the cell is COND * (cell_head - ELEV) when cell_head > ELEV, and zero otherwise. Represents the resistance to flow between the aquifer and the drain.
